title: How to Clean a DVD Player

steps.title: Remove any discs from the DVD player.
steps.content: Remove any discs from the DVD player. These will likely get jammed if you forget to remove them.

steps.title: Unplug the DVD player from the mains and your TV, and remove it from its stand/case etc.
steps.content: Unplug the DVD player from the mains and your TV, and remove it from its stand/case etc.

steps.title: Take a damp cloth and rub it gently across the top, front, and sides of your DVD player.
steps.content: Take a damp cloth and rub it gently across the top, front, and sides of your DVD player. Never wipe down the back of your DVD Player!

steps.title: If the back or underside of your DVD player is dirty, use a dry cloth to gently rub around all the ports and screws etc.
steps.content: If the back or underside of your DVD player is dirty, use a dry cloth to gently rub around all the ports and screws etc.

steps.title: Reconnect up the DVD player to the mains and TV.
steps.content: Reconnect up the DVD player to the mains and TV.

steps.title: Now play through your 'lens cleaning disc'.
steps.content: Now play through your 'lens cleaning disc'. This will gently remove any dirt inside the DVD player mechanism. This may take a while.

steps.title: You're done!
steps.content: You're done! You can now enjoy your movies a little bit more by knowing that your DVD player is clean.
